titleStmt.title: George P. Webster to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1719

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Office of Asst. qm
Covington Ky. Nov 9th 1863.
Hon. Thos E Bramlette
Governor. State of Ky.
Frankfort.
Sir

I Respectfully Request that Thomas Brooks be appointed Notary Public. He is a citizen and House Keeper in Kenton County Ky. (in Covington.) of good moral character and fully competent, my reasons for making the request is that I desire a notary in this office, as He would save much trouble and expense, My Brooks is a clerk in my office. Enclosed please find Two ($2) Dollars for, necessary expenses, fees in office Sect of State,

Very Respectfully
Your obt. Servt
Geo P Webster
Capt & a. q m
All that Capt. Webster says of Mr Brooks is true. I recommend the appointment

Kenton Co
N. P.
Thos Brooks
Comd.
11th Nov/63
